author: Staff Reporter
text:
Four persons were killed when the car they were travelling collided with a truck at Putharachal near Palladam on Tuesday morning.

The deceased were identified as L. Ramesh (45), a textile unit executive and resident of P.M. Pudur in Coimbatore, his brother L. Murali (65), a resident of J. S. Gardens along Tirupur-Kangayam road, and their cousins N. Balaji (21), an ITI student and resident of Edayarpalayam in Coimbatore, and C. Vishnu (25), who worked in a mutual fund company and resident of Vedapatty in Coimbatore. They were returning to Coimbatore after attending a function at Rameswaram when the accident occurred along Dharapuram-Palladam highway around 5.45 a.m.

All four of them were brought dead at taluk-government hospital at Palladam.

Superintendent of Police Saroj Kumar Thakur told The Hindu that preliminary investigations revealed that Balaji drove the car.

Senior police officials, who visited the spot, said the driver looked to have lost control over the vehicle, and it moved right to hit the truck which was coming through the correct lane.

The Kamanaickenpalayam police have registered a case and are further investigating.
title: Four die in road accident
